snippet: Florian Homm, a German arrested after five years in hiding, will make a final appeal against extradition to the Italian justice ministry, citing ill health.
abstract: German financier Florian Homm, who was arrested in Italy on United States charges of securities fraud after five years in hiding, will appeal to Italian Ministry of Justice in last-ditch attempt to avoid extradition.
lead_paragraph: Florian Homm, a German arrested after five years in hiding, will make a final appeal against extradition to the Italian justice ministry, citing ill health.

headline.main: For Financier, a Final Try to Avoid U.S. Charges
headline.print_headline: For Financier, A Final Try To Avoid U.S. Charges
